channel.title: Loading problem
channel.description: i have a mac computer and when i open silab its loads a lil bit and then just stops and freezes. also with pkclient i open it and there is a paper and this sign ! on left hand corner and i try to play moparscape it never works. i cant login into a server. please can someone help me with these things. how do i make the computer trust a site cuz silab and pkclient arent trusted please someone help me im trying EVERYTHING its not working!

item.title: Loading problem
item.dc:creator: @untouchable818 untouchable818
item.description:
@untouchable818 wrote:

do u no a moparscape client that is for mac and how do i make a site be trusted on a mac

Read full topic

item.title: Loading problem
item.dc:creator: @Kayceee Kayceee
item.description:
@Kayceee wrote:

You can’t play RSPS on Mac’s unless theirs either a Webclient or .exe file to run the client from.
Mac’s run on shellscript which is a completely different type of system/coding Windows XP/Vista/7 run on.
Also, macs are all 64-bit which means that it’s very very hard to find a server which will allow you to play.
You will also need Java, if you don’t already have it.

Another alternative is (If you don’t have a computer with Windows XP/Windows Vista/Windows 7) Is to download BootCamp for Mac.

This allows you to run another Operating system within your mac, therefore enabling you to use the other Operating system to play Servers on!
Hope this helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Loading problem
item.dc:creator: @tb1 tb
item.description:
@tb1 wrote:

Do you have a windows computer? Most people have those type computers so servers work better on them then mac. Also if your an admin on your computer, you can change your trusted sites, and it will let you on it easy.

Read full topic
